title: Dandelion
provenance_text:
Harry Bertoia [1915-1978], Barto, PA, until January 1959 [1]; Mr. [1908-1987] and Mrs. H. J. Heinz II, Pittsburgh, PA, January 1959 until at least November 1968 [2]; H. J. Heinz Company, Pittsburgh, PA, by October 1975 [3]; Concept Art Gallery, Pittsburgh, PA, by October 8, 2001 [4]; purchased by Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, December 2001.

Notes:
[1]. The sculpture was exhibited (no. 43) in "The 1958 Pittsburgh Bicentennial International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at Carnegie Institute, December 1958 - February 1959. 
[2]. Mr. and Mrs. H. J. Heinz II purchased the sculpture from the International in January 1959 for $1,000 (payment acknowledged by the artist on January 31, 1959.) They are listed as lenders of the sculpture (no. 7) to the exhibition "Sculpture We Live with: Privately Owned in the Pittsburgh Area" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, November 1968 - January 1969. 
[3]. The sculpture was included in the exhibition "Pittsburgh Corporations Collect" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, October 1975 - January 1976. The sculpture (no. 49) is listed under the H. J. Heinz Company collection. See also provenance information from Concept Art Gallery in curatorial file.
[4]. See correspondence with Concept Art Gallery in curatorial file.
